revised_title: Avian SRY Sequences and the Evolution of Sex Determination
tldr: The author isolated conserved DNA sequences related to the human sex-determining region Y gene from the lesser black-backed gull. The study found that these sequences fall into two subfamilies, suggesting that the avian and mammalian SRY-type sequences share a common ancestor. The results also showed that Y-chromosome-linked SRY genes have evolved at a faster rate than autosomal SRY-box genes.
